CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 14+P1-1 - Prohibition of discrimination (Article 14 - Discrimination) (Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property;Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)

TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia ( “ the SFRY ” ) was a federal ORG composed of CARDINAL republics : GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE . Nationals of the SFRY had “ dual citizenship ” for internal purposes , that is to say they were citizens of both the SFRY and one of the CARDINAL GPE . They had freedom of movement within the federal ORG and could register as permanent residents wherever they settled on its territory .

CARDINAL . The SFRY had CARDINAL pension systems – military and civil . The pension rights of military personnel were regulated by and secured through the federal authorities . In particular , members of ORG ( hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) , the armed forces of the SFRY , paid their contributions to and received their pensions from a special military pension fund based in GPE ( GPE za socialno osiguranje vojnih osiguranika , hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) . ORG paid pensions to military pensioners irrespective of where they undertook military service or lived once retired . This was the only pension fund existing at federal level . In parallel , each republic had in place its own pension legislation and public pension fund set up for the payment of civil pensions .
CARDINAL . DATE the SFRY broke up . On DATE GPE declared its independence .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG issued the LAW on the payment of advances on military pensions ( see paragraph CARDINAL below , hereinafter “ the Ordinance ” ) which regulated , on a temporary basis , the payment of military pensions to former ORG military personnel residing in GPE who had applied for or fulfilled the conditions for retirement under the rules governing the pension and disability insurance of military personnel ( hereinafter “ the SFRY military rules ” ) by DATE , the date of withdrawal of the ORG from GPE ( see PERSON GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , Commission decision of DATE , ORG and Reports ( DR ) CARDINAL , p. CARDINAL ) . This was followed in DATE by a new LAW from ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below , hereinafter “ the DATE LAW ) which put in place a comprehensive regulatory framework for the pension rights of former ORG military personnel , in most cases allowing for pensions to be paid only to NORP nationals .

CARDINAL . In DATE GPE ( succeeded in DATE by GPE ) transformed ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) into ORG on the basis of LAW . The ( transformed ) ORG continued paying ORG pensions to the citizens of GPE . However , it remains uncertain to what extent , if at all , the ORG continued paying ORG pensions to the citizens of GPE residing in the other former ORG ( see also , mutatis mutandis , PERSON v. GPE , and PERSON v. GPE , ( dec . ) , nos . ORG and CARDINAL others , § CARDINAL , DATE ) .

At the inter - State level , however , the question of responsibility for the payment of pensions to military personnel who had acquired or applied for pensions with ORG under the rules governing the pension and disability insurance of military personnel ( hereinafter “ the SFRY military rules ” ) remained unresolved until LAW entered into force in DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant was a citizen of GPE in the SFRY . Following its dissolution , he retained citizenship of the then GPE . CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied for an advance on his military pension under the Ordinance ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
